summary:
The Security Council, recalling resolution 1740 (2007), welcomes the Comprehensive Peace Agreement between the Government of Nepal and the Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist) and commends steps taken to implement it. The Council reaffirms Nepal's sovereignty and ownership of the peace process and expresses readiness to support timely implementation of the Agreement. 

The Council recognizes civil society's role in conflict prevention and welcomes the report of the Secretary-General on the UN Mission in Nepal (UNMIN). It notes the 23-point agreement to hold Constituent Assembly elections on 10 April 2008 and stresses the need for mutual confidence among parties.

The Council renews UNMIN's mandate until 23 July 2008, following the Government of Nepal's request and the Secretary-General's recommendation. It calls on parties to maintain momentum in implementing the Comprehensive Peace Agreement, engage constructively with the UN, and work towards Constituent Assembly elections.

The Council encourages parties to utilize UNMIN's expertise to support the peace process and requests the Secretary-General to keep it informed of progress. It requests parties to ensure the safety and security of UNMIN personnel and decides to remain seized of the matter.
